words.definition: To adapt means to change to fit a new situation.
words.example: It took him a while to adapt to the new school.

words.definition: Biological relates to living things.
words.example: The scientist studied the biological processes of plants.

words.definition: Cellular relates to the cells of a living thing.
words.example: Cancer is a disease caused by abnormal cellular growth.

words.definition: When something is dynamic, it is full of energy and change.
words.example: The city has a dynamic nightlife.

words.definition: Fantasy is a pleasant situation that is not real.
words.example: The child lived in a world of fantasy.

words.definition: Heredity is the passing of traits from parents to children.
words.example: Heredity determines the color of your eyes.

words.definition: If something is internal, it is on the inside.
words.example: The medicine is for internal use only.

words.definition: When something is minimal, it is very small in amount or degree.
words.example: The damage to the car was minimal.

words.definition: A pioneer is a person who is among the first to do something.
words.example: He was a pioneer in the field of heart surgery.

words.definition: To prescribe medicine means to tell someone to take it.
words.example: The doctor prescribed an antibiotic for my infection.

words.definition: Respective relates separately to each of the people or things mentioned.
words.example: The students went to their respective classrooms.

words.definition: To revive something means to bring it back to life or health.
words.example: The cool water revived the tired plants.

words.definition: If something is rigid, it is stiff and does not bend easily.
words.example: The rules were rigid and could not be changed.

words.definition: A sequence is a series of events or things that happen in order.
words.example: The sequence of events led to a happy ending.

words.definition: To substitute something means to use it instead of something else.
words.example: We used honey as a substitute for sugar.

words.definition: A surgeon is a doctor who performs operations.
words.example: The surgeon was very skillful during the operation.

words.definition: Therapy is a treatment for a physical or mental illness.
words.example: The physical therapy helped him walk again.

words.definition: To transfer something means to move it from one place to another.
words.example: He transferred the money to his bank account.

words.definition: A transition is a change from one condition to another.
words.example: The country is in a state of transition.

words.definition: A transplant is an operation in which an organ is moved from one body to another.
words.example: He needed a kidney transplant to survive.
